title: Lufthansa brings in new fare system
text:
Lufthansa brings in new fare system 28 July 2015 Save 
Lufthansa is to introduce a new fare concept for flights within Europe with three different options for economy flights. 
The new categories will be “light”, “classic” and “flex” will apply form October 1 this year for domestic and European flights. 
The various fare options differentiate themselves in the areas of free luggage, seat reservations, as well as rebooking and cancellations options. The choice will now consist of a fully flexible business class fare and three new economy class fares. 
Jens Bischof, member of the Lufthansa German Airlines Board and chief commercial officer of Deutsche Lufthansa AG, said: “It is the wish of many customers to only pay for the services they actually make use of. 
“With this new fare concept, we are doing just that. In the future, given this flexibility, every passenger will be able to individually create a tailor-made flight with the various service components that we are offering. 
“The price options, Light, Classic and Flex, are more transparent and allow customers in Economy Class a selection of fare options within Europe.”
